quiz.title: Economics: Monopoly, Business Forms, and Firm Objectives

questions.question: In case of monopoly:
options: Marginal revenue curve always slopes upward
Total revenue curve always slopes upward
Marginal revenue is always equal to average revenue
Marginal revenue is always less than average revenue
questions.explanation: For a monopolist (and any firm facing a downwardâ€‘sloping demand curve), marginal revenue (MR) is less than price (AR), so MR < AR at every output level.

questions.question: Firms owned by stockholders are known as:
questions.explanation: Corporations are legal entities owned by shareholders (stockholders) who have limited liability and can trade ownership shares.

questions.question: The major objective of a firm is:
questions.explanation: Traditional economic theory assumes the primary objective of a firm is to maximize profit (or shareholder value).

questions.question: In the short run:
options: Some inputs are fixed and some variable
Firms are bound to break even
questions.explanation: The short run is defined as a period during which at least one factor of production is fixed; others can be varied.
